string-array.name: Descriptions
string-array.item: This course examines the goals and methods of artificial intelligence. The goals are to understand and to create intelligent software.
Comparative study of programming languages. Formal language definition; the Backus-Naur form and syntax graphs. Run-time considerations. Interpretive languages.
This course introduces the student to one of the major Mobile Computing platforms, and develops their ability to write software applications for the platform.

Design of efficient algorithms. Space and time complexity. Bounds on the performance of algorithms. Problems from such areas as sorting, data structures and arithmetic computations will be discussed. NP completeness.
